intro: Ficinia pseudoschoenus, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a dense, compact cluster. Its flowering structures, called spikelets, are borne on tall, slender stems and produce small, wind-pollinated flowers. Ficinia pseudoschoenus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
